intro: Isanthus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy isanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Isanthus pubescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
